change.description: Move meteg (siluq) from vav to following resh.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah het patah shin shin-dot sheva vav tsere meteg resh holam shin shin-dot sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah het patah shin shin-dot sheva vav tsere resh holam meteg shin shin-dot sof-pasuq

change.refuni: he hiriq nun dagesh segol nun dagesh mahapakh vav dagesh
change.changeuni: he hiriq nun dagesh segol mahapakh nun dagesh vav dagesh

change.refuni: tav patah ayin hataf-patah nun segol nun dagesh etnahta vav dagesh
change.changeuni: tav patah ayin hataf-patah nun segol etnahta nun dagesh vav dagesh

summary.note: Earlier changes inserting zero-width-joiners (ZWJ) to avoid mark collisions are no longer necessary.

change.refuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats zero-width-joiner meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah revia yod
change.changeuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah revia yod

notes.note: This verse matches Deut 5:7.7.
The ZWJ is no longer needed for mark positioning. Change is invisible.

change.refuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats zero-width-joiner meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah revia yod
change.changeuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah revia yod

notes.note: This verse matches Ex 20:3.7.
The ZWJ is no longer needed for mark positioning. Change is invisible.

change.description: Move merkha from resh to zayin.
change.refuni: zayin qamats resh merkha vav dagesh
change.changeuni: zayin qamats merkha resh vav dagesh

change.description: Unusual order of accents on nun; add note 'c'.
change.refuni: nun patah revia geresh het sheva lamed qamats he
change.changeuni: nun patah revia geresh het sheva lamed qamats he

notes.note: Here the LC has a revia followed by a geresh-shaped mark. This is probably an unusual presentation of the two-mark accent revia mugrash. The usual encoding of a revia mugrash (241 instances) is a geresh muqdam (x059d), a prepositive mark, followed by revia (x0597).

change.description: Replace holam with revia, add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg dalet holam nun qamats yod
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg dalet nun qamats revia yod

notes.note: The LC has a dot above the nun. The transcription problem is to determine whether the dot is a holam or a revia. If the dot represents a holam, then the word is without an accent; if it represents a revia it lacks an expected vowel.

Seth (Avi) Kadish points out: "Many masoretic manuscripts leave out the ḥolam dot in the divine name as a rule, and some do so even when it is spelled אדני. While the LC itself normally has the ḥolam dot in the spelling אדני, here it does not. This should be considered an anomaly rather than an error, and the dot that appears directly over the letter נ should be understood as a revia` rather than ḥolam. It is even possible that the single dot is intended to serve both purposes."

change.refuni: het hataf-patah mem qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats qadma
change.changeuni: het hataf-patah mem qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia

change.description: Add sheva to second lamed, remove dagesh from vav, add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he patah meteg lamed sheva lamed vav dagesh yod qamats qadma he dagesh space paseq
change.changeuni: he patah meteg lamed sheva lamed sheva vav yod qamats qadma he dagesh space paseq

notes.note: The LC clearly has a sheva on the second lamed and lacks a dagesh on the vav.
The normal spelling would have no sheva on the second lamed and would have a dagesh on the vav. The LC is anomalous and the UXLC replicates it correctly.
A hint of a maqaf might be seen between the vav and the yod. The immediately preceding word in Ps 105:45.6 shows a very distinct maqaf, however.

change.description: Move patach to ayin, add note 't'.
change.refuni: he vav holam pe hiriq meteg yod patah ayin sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: he vav holam pe hiriq meteg yod ayin patah sof-pasuq

notes.note: In the LC, the patach appears to belong to the yod, not the ayin. The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) assigns the patach to the ayin, which is what would be expected grammatically: a furtive patach on ayin. The UXLC transcription does the same as MAM: it assigns the patach to the ayin. That is, the UXLC transcription assumes that the scribe's placement of this patach is just an extreme example of the normal "early" (right-biased) placement of a furtive patach.

change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh patah shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh hiriq munah yod patah ayin
change.changeuni: he patah mem dagesh patah shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh hiriq munah yod ayin patah

notes.note: In the LC the patach is located between the yod and the ayin. It's probably a furtive patach, and thus should be coded as belonging to the ayin not the yod. (It is normal for the scribe to give a furtive patach an "early" (right-biased) placement.)

change.description: Add maqaf, change tipeha to meteg, add note 't'.
change.refuni: bet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
change.changeuni: bet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats meteg maqaf

notes.note: The maqaf is clear in the LC.

The accent under the qamats of the final kaf could be either a tipeha, a primary accent, or a meteg, a secondary accent. A tipeha is a diagonal line from northwest to southeast, a meteg is a vertical line. When a maqaf is added to this word it becomes a poetic word with the following word, Ps 31:2.2. Poetic words normally contain a single primary accent. Word Ps 31:2.2 has a clear primary munah accent, thus the accent in question is likely to be a meteg, a secondary accent.
Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001) has a meteg for the accent in question.

change.refuni: tav dagesh hiriq dalet sheva resh holam meteg shin shin-dot sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: tav hiriq dalet sheva resh holam meteg shin shin-dot sof-pasuq

change.refuni: tav sheva meteg he hiriq lamed dagesh qamats ole tav hiriq merkha yod
change.changeuni: tav dagesh sheva meteg he hiriq lamed dagesh qamats ole tav hiriq merkha yod

notes.note: The dagesh is late in the tav, but otherwise has the correct color and position.

change.refuni: bet dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem etnahta vav holam
change.changeuni: bet hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem etnahta vav holam

change.description: Add dagesh to first sin, add note 't'.
change.refuni: shin sin-dot patah revia shin sin-dot sheva tav dagesh hiriq yod
change.changeuni: shin dagesh sin-dot patah revia shin sin-dot sheva tav dagesh hiriq yod

notes.note: The dagesh on the first sin is unclear or split.
The Aleppo Codex has a dagesh on the first sin, but it is blurry.
Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001) does not have a dagesh on the sin.

change.refuni: tav vav holam tsadi hiriq tipeha yod alef
change.changeuni: tav dagesh vav holam tsadi hiriq tipeha yod alef

change.refuni: bet sheva tav holam munah final-pe
change.changeuni: bet dagesh sheva tav holam munah final-pe

change.refuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha yod
change.changeuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere munah yod

change.description: Remove dagesh (=mapiq) on he, add note 't'.
change.refuni: ayin qamats merkha shin sin-dot qamats he dagesh
change.changeuni: ayin qamats merkha shin sin-dot qamats he

notes.note: The dagesh (=mapiq) on the he is light and brown; it's likely to be an artifact.

change.description: Change zaqef qatan to revia, add note 't'.
change.refuni: alef hiriq tav dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam
change.changeuni: alef hiriq tav dagesh revia vav holam

notes.note: The upper dot of the zaqef qatan is light, brown, and more circular than expected; it's likely to be an artifact.

change.description: Remove dagesh on bet, add note 't'.
change.refuni: bet dagesh qamats alef tav segol tipeha final-mem
change.changeuni: bet qamats alef tav segol tipeha final-mem

notes.note: The dagesh on the bet is very light and brown; it's likely to be an artifact.

change.description: Change tevir on nun to merkha, add note 't'.
change.refuni: nun qamats tevir tav patah final-nun
change.changeuni: nun qamats merkha tav patah final-nun

notes.note: Dot making the tevir is light, brown, and lower than expected; it's likely to be an artifact.

change.refuni: ayin qamats lamed segol meteg yod he dagesh qamats sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: ayin qamats lamed segol meteg yod he qamats sof-pasuq

notes.note: The dagesh (=mapiq) on the he is light, brown and misshapen; it's likely to be an artifact.

change.description: Move munah from lamed to kaf.
change.refuni: lamed qamats munah kaf segol final-mem
change.changeuni: lamed qamats kaf segol munah final-mem

change.description: Word lacks a maqaf so that it has no primary accent. Add note 'c'.
change.refuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg resh hiriq meteg yod final-kaf sheva
change.changeuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg resh hiriq meteg yod final-kaf sheva

notes.note: The lack of a maqaf on this word means the it has no primary accent. Instead, it has two metegs, an unusual marking.
The digital text correctly represents the LC which has no maqaf.

change.refuni: kaf holam munah lamed
change.changeuni: kaf dagesh holam munah lamed

change.description: Unexpected hataf qamats on initial he, missing dagesh on shin; add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he hataf-qamats shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan he
change.changeuni: he hataf-qamats shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan he

notes.note: The LC has a hataf qamats on the initial he and the following shin lacks a dagesh. The usual marking has a qamatz on the he and a dagesh on the shin as in the Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM).
The UXLC transcribes the LC correctly, however.

change.description: Missing dagesh on shin; add note 'c'.
change.refuni: he qamats shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats tipeha he
change.changeuni: he qamats shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats tipeha he

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh on the shin. The usual marking has a dagesh on the shin as in the Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM).
The UXLC transcribes the LC correctly, however.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun pashta
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun pashta

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh tipeha vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh tipeha vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.description: Add note 'c' to tsadi with unexpected dagesh.
change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh munah vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh munah vav holam final-nun

notes.note: This is the sole occurence in the LC where this word, מציון, is vocalized as מִצִּיּ֣וֹן. That is, the tsadi has a dagesh. All other occurences have no dagesh in the tsadi. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun pashta
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun pashta

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun zinor
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun zinor

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: vav dagesh geresh-muqdam mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh revia vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: vav dagesh geresh-muqdam mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh revia vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for the word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The vav-prefixed form here, וּ֝מִצִיּ֗וֹן, follows the pattern by having no dagesh in the tsadi. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh merkha vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh merkha vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun zinor
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh vav holam final-nun zinor

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh etnahta vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh etnahta vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq ole yod dagesh merkha vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq ole yod dagesh merkha vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh etnahta vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh etnahta vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh revia vav holam final-nun
change.changeuni: mem hiriq tsadi hiriq yod dagesh revia vav holam final-nun

notes.note: The LC generally has no dagesh in the tsadi for this word, מִצִיּוֹן. (Exception: Joel 4:16.2). The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh patah dalet dagesh patah merkha yod
change.changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot patah dalet dagesh patah merkha yod

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin this word, מִשַׁדַּי. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.

change.description: Remove dagesh from shin, add note 't'.
change.refuni: mem hiriq dehi shin shin-dot dagesh patah dalet dagesh patah yod
change.changeuni: mem hiriq dehi shin shin-dot patah dalet dagesh patah yod

notes.note: The LC has no obvious dagesh in the shin this word, מִשַׁדַּי. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.
The text is in poor condition here.

change.refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh patah dalet dagesh patah merkha yod
change.changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot patah dalet dagesh patah merkha yod

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin this word, מִשַׁדַּי. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.

change.refuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq tet dagesh patah he tsere tipeha resh
change.changeuni: he patah mem hiriq tet dagesh patah he tsere tipeha resh

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the mem on this word, הַמִטַּהֵ֖ר. This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the mem.

change.refuni: he patah meteg nun dagesh hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
change.changeuni: he patah meteg nun hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the nun on this word, הַֽנִבְּאִ֤ים. This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the nun.
Notice the slight bulge on the bet following the nun.

change.refuni: he patah tsadi dagesh hiriq yod dagesh munah vav dagesh final-nun
change.changeuni: he patah tsadi hiriq yod dagesh munah vav dagesh final-nun

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the tsadi on this word, הַצִיּ֣וּן. This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats revia tav
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats revia tav

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin on this word, the FIRST השבת in the verse (with revia). This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.
Note that in this verse, two instances of השבת (words 7, 26) lack a dagesh in the shin; one instance of השבת (word 17, with etnahta) does have a dagesh in the shin.

change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin on this word, the LAST השבת in the verse (with siluq). This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.
Note that in this verse, two instances of השבת (words 7, 26) lack a dagesh in the shin; one instance of השבת (word 17, with etnahta) does have a dagesh in the shin.

change.refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin on this word. This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.

change.refuni: mem tsere meteg he patah shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq tet dagesh hiriq revia yod final-mem
change.changeuni: mem tsere meteg he patah shin shin-dot hiriq tet dagesh hiriq revia yod final-mem

notes.note: The LC has no dagesh in the shin on this word. This lack of dagesh is inconsistent with grammatical expectations. The Miqra according to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the shin.
